abstracts.cdata!:
The development objectives of the
            Southern Sudan Umbrella Program for Health System
            Development Project is to improve the delivery of the Basic
            Package of Health Services (BPHS) in four states (Upper
            Nile, Jongeli, Central Equatoria, and Eastern Equatoria);
            strengthen the key stewardship functions of the Ministry of
            Health (MOH), including monitoring. The closing date of the
            project will be extended from June 30, 2012 until September
            28, 2012. The extension will give enough time for the
            successful completion of ongoing activities and a successful
            achievement of the development objective. The MOH, which is
            the implementing entity, has submitted through MOFEP the
            formal request for extension of the project up to September
            28, 2012. The MOH has also submitted the revised plan of
            action which shows that the planned activities under the
            project will be completed by September 28, 2012. This will
            be the second extension of the project for a total of three months.
